description: The responses from manufacturing that are associated with a job order shall be defined as a job response.
title: Job response
$comment: According to ANSI/ISA-95.00.04-2018 Enterprise-Control System Integration âˆ’ Part 4: Objects and Attributes for - Approved 24 May 2018

links.dtdl:description: The work master(s) related to this job response
The work directive(s) related to this job response
The workflow specification(s) related to this job response
The workflow specification node(s) related to this job response
The job order(s) related to this job response
Data associated with this job response
The personnel actual(s) related to this job response
The equipment actual(s) related to this job response
The physical asset actual(s) related to this job response
The material actual(s) related to this job response

links.x-jsonschema:$comment: Not part of the Standard Specs.

oneOf.$comment: can be used when the activity contains several categories

jobOrder.title: Job order
jobOrder.description: An identification of the associated job order.
jobOrder.comment: Job responses may not relate to a job order, it may be a report on all work for a specific time or reported on by plant floor events.

startTime.title: Start Time
startTime.description: The starting time of this job response.

endTime.title: End Time
endTime.description: The ending time of this job response.

hierarchyScope.title: Hierarchy scope
hierarchyScope.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy. Optionally, hierarchy scope defines the scope of the equipment class, such as the site or area where it is defined.

jobState.title: Job state
jobState.description: Indicates the state of the work response.
